verses.text: Why do the \w heathen|strong="H1471"\w* \w rage|strong="H7283"\w*, and the \w people|strong="H3816"\w* \w imagine|strong="H1897"\w* a vain \w thing|strong="H7385"\w*?\f + \fr 2.1 \ft rage: or, tumultuously assemble\f*\f + \fr 2.1 \ft imagine: Heb. meditate\f*

The \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* of the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w* \w set|strong="H3320"\w* themselves, and the \w rulers|strong="H7336"\w* take \w counsel|strong="H3245"\w* \w together|strong="H3162"\w*, against the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and against his \w anointed|strong="H4899"\w*, \add saying\add*,
Let us \w break|strong="H5423"\w* their \w bands|strong="H4147"\w* \w asunder|strong="H5423"\w*, and cast \w away|strong="H7993"\w* their \w cords|strong="H5688"\w* from us.
He that \w sitteth|strong="H3427"\w* in the \w heavens|strong="H8064"\w* shall \w laugh|strong="H7832"\w*: the \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w* shall have them in \w derision|strong="H3932"\w*.

Then shall he \w speak|strong="H1696"\w* unto them in his \w wrath|strong="H0639"\w*, and \w vex|strong="H0926"\w* them in his sore \w displeasure|strong="H2740"\w*.\f + \fr 2.5 \ft vex: or, trouble\f*

Yet have I \w set|strong="H5258"\w* my \w king|strong="H4428"\w* upon my \w holy|strong="H6944"\w* \w hill|strong="H2022"\w* of \w Zion|strong="H6726"\w*.\f + \fr 2.6 \ft set: Heb. anointed\f*\f + \fr 2.6 \ft upon…: Heb. upon Zion, the hill of my holiness\f*

I will \w declare|strong="H5608"\w* the \w decree|strong="H2706"\w*: the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto me, Thou \add art\add* my \w Son|strong="H1121"\w*; this \w day|strong="H3117"\w* have I \w begotten|strong="H3205"\w* thee.\f + \fr 2.7 \ft the decree: or, for a decree\f*

\w Ask|strong="H7592"\w* of me, and I shall \w give|strong="H5414"\w* \add thee\add* the \w heathen|strong="H1471"\w* \add for\add* thine \w inheritance|strong="H5159"\w*, and the uttermost \w parts|strong="H0657"\w* of the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w* \add for\add* thy \w possession|strong="H0272"\w*.

Thou shalt \w break|strong="H7489"\w* them with a \w rod|strong="H7626"\w* of \w iron|strong="H1270"\w*; thou shalt dash them in \w pieces|strong="H5310"\w* like a \w potter’s|strong="H3335"\w* \w vessel|strong="H3627"\w*.
Be \w wise|strong="H7919"\w* now therefore, O ye \w kings|strong="H4428"\w*: be \w instructed|strong="H3256"\w*, ye \w judges|strong="H8199"\w* of the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*.
\w Serve|strong="H5647"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* with \w fear|strong="H3374"\w*, and \w rejoice|strong="H1523"\w* with \w trembling|strong="H7461"\w*.

\w Kiss|strong="H5401"\w* the \w Son|strong="H1248"\w*, lest he be \w angry|strong="H0599"\w*, and ye \w perish|strong="H0006"\w* \add from\add* the \w way|strong="H1870"\w*, when his \w wrath|strong="H0639"\w* is \w kindled|strong="H1197"\w* but a \w little|strong="H4592"\w*. \w Blessed|strong="H0835"\w* \add are\add* all they that put their \w trust|strong="H2620"\w* in him.
